action.primary: Tonifies the Kidneys, replenishes Jing and strengthens the back and knees

indications: Kidney Yang Deficiency with a Cold and painful back and knees and urinary frequency

action.primary: Warms and astringes the Lungs, resolves cold Phlegm, arrests wheezing and helps the Kidneys grasp Qi

indications: Lung and Kidney Deficiencies with chronic cough and wheezing that worsens with any exertion
Kidney unable to grasp Lung Qi

action.primary: Moistens the Intestines and unblocks the bowels

indications: Constipation from Deficient Fluids and Blood
Constipation due to injured Fluids following a febrile disorder

contraindications: Contraindicated for those with Phlegm Fire.
Contraindicated for those with Hot cough.
Contraindicated for those with Yin Deficiency with Heat signs.
Contraindicated for those with watery stool.
Do not take with strong tea.
interactions: Hu Tao Ren has anticoagulant and thrombolytic effects and should be used with caution in patients who take anticoagulant or antiplatelet medication such as warfarin (Coumadin), heparin, enoxaparin (Lovenox), aspirin, dipyridamole (Persantine) and clopidogrel (Plavix)

useCases: Low back and knee pain and weakness in the legs from Kidney Deficiency.
Back pain associated with Kidney stones.
Wheezing from Deficient Lungs and Kidneys.
Chronic cough due to Deficiency Cold.
Concurrent lower back pain and weak legs from Wind-Damp Bi.
Constipation due to insufficient fluids in the Large Intestine.
Low back pain with premature ejaculation, coughing and wheezing due to Kidney Yang Deficiency.

Fortifies Kidney Yang to help it grasp the Qi in treating coughs and wheezing, strengthens the sinews and bones and treats aching of the lower back and knees, impotence and premature ejaculation due to Lower Jiao Cold.

notes: This herb is prescribed when both Kidneys and Lung are involved.
This herb is gentle and generally serves as an assistant.

One sources says that Walnuts can tonify the Qi, nourish the Blood, moisten Dryness, transform Phlegm, augment the Ming Men, facilitate the San Jiao, warm the Lungs, and moisten the Intestines to treat coughs due to Deficiency Cold and heavy pain in the low back and feet.
One source says that this herb enriches and tonifies the Liver and Kidneys and strengthens sinews and bones. It stabilizes the teeth and blackens the hair.
